All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Attribute
The Attribute class is an abstract class that contains a name and index field, as well as methods for getting the name and index.
Cluster
The 'Cluster' class represents a cluster of centroids and contains methods for computing the centroid, adding and removing data centroids, and generating a string representation of the cluster.
ClusterSet
The ClusterSet class represents a set of clusters (determined by k-means) and provides methods for initializing centroids, finding the nearest cluster to a given tuple, updating centroids, and generating string representations of the clusters.
ContinuousAttribute
The ContinuousAttribute class represents a continuous attribute with a minimum and maximum value, and provides a method to scale a given value to a range between 0 and 1.
ContinuousItem
The ContinuousItem class extends the Item class and calculates the distance between two continuous attribute values.
Data
The Data class models the set of transactions (or tuples)
DatabaseConnectionException
The class "DatabaseConnectionException" is a custom exception class in Java that extends the built-in "Exception" class and is used to handle errors related to database connections.
DbAccess
The 'DbAccess' class establishes a connection to a MySQL database and provides methods for initializing, getting, and closing the connection.
DiscreteAttribute
The DiscreteAttribute class represents an attribute with a set of discrete values and provides methods for getting the values, the number of distinct values, and the frequency of a specific value in a given data set.
DiscreteItem
The DiscreteItem class extends the Item class and calculates the distance between two discrete attribute values.
EmptySetException
The class "EmptySetException" is a custom exception class in Java that extends the built-in "Exception" class and is used to handle errors related to an empty set.
Example
The Example class implements the Comparable interface and contains methods for adding objects to a list, getting objects from the list, comparing Example objects, and getting the list as a string representation.
Item
The Item class represents an attribute-value pair and provides methods for computing distance and updating the value.
Keyboard
 
KMeansMiner
The KMeansMiner class implements the K-means clustering algorithm for data mining.
MultiServer
The MultiServer class creates a server that listens for incoming client connections on a specified port and creates a new thread for each client connection that will be handle by the class 'ServerOneClient'.
NoValueException
The class "NoValueException" is a custom exception class in Java that extends the built-in "Exception" class and is used to handle errors related to an incorrect value input.
OutOfRangeSampleSize
The class "OutOfRangeSampleSize" is a custom exception class in Java that extends the built-in "Exception" class and is used to handle errors related to an incorrect range input.
QUERY_TYPE
Enumeration class called 'QUERY_TYPE' with two possible values: 'MIN' and 'MAX'.
ServerException
The class "ServerException" is a custom exception class in Java that extends the built-in "Exception" class and is used to handle errors related to a server error.
ServerOneClient
The ServerOneClient class is a thread that handles client requests for clustering data using the KMeans algorithm and saving or opening serialised files.
TableData
The TableData class provides methods for retrieving distinct transactions, distinct column values, and aggregate column values from a database table.
TableSchema
The TableSchema class retrieves and stores the schema information of a database table.
Tuple
The Tuple class contains methods for creating and manipulating an array of Item objects, calculating distances between tuples, and calculating the average distance of items in a cluster from the centroid.
